basics.name: CRAIG Gabron
basics.label: Senior Client Advocate II
basics.summary: Motivated Business Analyst with the technical expertise and business acumen necessary to translate business requirements and objectives into scalable, highly resilient and successful system solutions.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Supported BlueCross BlueShield of South Carolina's TRICARE (Military Health Insurance) line of business functioning in an analyst role. Worked in a matrix environment across cross-functional teams and produced results in a highly dynamic and formative environment.
highlights: Documented business processes and analyzed procedures to meet changing business needs
Conducted interviews with key business users to collect information on business processes
Identified process inefficiencies through gap analysis
Increased annual revenue by 5% by suggesting improvements
Performed TRICARE bench marking analysis and identified potential product enhancements
Researched and resolved issues regarding extracting data from a clinical EHR for HEDIS measure calculation

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Managed the relationship between the Health Net, BlueCross Operations and BlueCross Information Systems Application areas with ten direct reports.
highlights: Optimized and managed research and development spending through collaboration with key business leaders
Trained four new employees on accounting principles and company procedures
Created periodic reports comparing budgeted costs to actual costs
Suggested budgetary changes to increase company profits
Provided timely actuals, forecast and budget data for IT and corporate management
Worked with management at the project level to ensure expense plans are achieved

work.name: Information Systems
work.summary: Managed the relationship with Cable and Wireless Communications in London, England on the installation of a telecom billing system, leading a team of 12 analysts and programmers in the analysis, design and coding of the international telecommunications commercial billing software.
highlights: Gathered detailed use cases and requirements through regular on-site visits, virtual meetings and customer advisory board sessions
Translated business goals, feature concepts and customer needs into prioritized product requirements and use cases
Collaborated with the sales, marketing and support teams to launch products on time and within budget
Coached and mentored twelve new staff members, including conducting performance reviews
Led communication with stakeholders regarding product goals and progress made
Tested and implemented new technology-based global projects such as international telephone billing system
Created innovative and intuitive product features such as a packetize billing system

education.institution: Slippery Rock University of Pennsylvania Northampton Community College
education.area: Health and Physical Education Computer Science and Information Technology

awards.title: Workgroup for Electronic Data Interchange (WEDI) Award of Merit
awards.summary: Awarded 2 years in a row for educating the health care industry on electronic claims attachments.
